answers.answer: This sounds more than just behavioral.  Please bring a fresh urine sample to the vet ASAP.  He could have a urinary tract infection, diabetes insipidus, behavioral polydipsia, and more.If it turns out that all is normal, post again for a behavioral discussion.

question: My 7 month old Beagle, Deegan, recently started peeing in the house. He has been house broken for about 2 months now.  My husband and I have been traveling more often recently so Deegan is not getting 100% of our attention.  Last night is when this all started.  We were playing with Deegan but when we had to stop playing Deegan jumped on the sofa and peed.  Later on when we went to bed Deegan wanted to get in bed with us.  He always sleeps in his own bed that is right next to ours.  I said "no" so Deegan went to his bed and peed in it. I took him outside immediately and he didn’t have to go. So this morning while I was getting dressed to go to work I couldn’t focus all of attention on Deegan.   The next thing I know he is peeing on the staircase.  This was the third time in less then 24 hours!!!!!  What is wrong with Deegan?  It seems to be happening when we are not paying full attention to him or when we say NO.   What can we do to make this stop?
title: My house trained dog started to pee in the house
